summary.text:
**Summarizing algorithm approach**

I need to summarize the main points regarding the new candidate family and the upper bounds (UB) for a given algorithm. I noted that the UB yields Θ(n log n) and the BST upper bounds from the Wilber-1 provides O(n) for tailored references, while Tango gives O(n log log n). I'll correct previous approaches that didn't work, focusing on the improvements and new candidate. It’s also essential to formalize various proofs and maybe try to improve the optimality through empirical checks.

The user requested 1–3 citations for the relied-upon files. I noticed several sections, such as "Corrections and guidance," "Current Proofs," and "Verifier Summary," that seem appropriate for citation. Since JSON schema doesn't have a specific citations field, I can add them to the summary at the end, formatted properly. I’ll make sure the overall summary doesn't exceed 200 words, ideally around 100-150 words. For a concise one-liner, I can summarize that the new 2413-inflation permutation achieves UB=Θ(n log n) and OPT≤O(n log log n).

I’m highlighting a few key points for the user. First, I've corrected the bit-reversal upper bound claim to Ω(n) instead of Ω(n log n). Additionally, I've noted that the round-robin construction fails due to small witnesses. The new family, π_h, incorporates a recursive interleaving technique. I've also described bounds using the LCA bijection and BST upper bounds with explanations for tailored trees. Next, I’ll focus on formalizing proofs and potentially computing empirical costs. I’ll also remember to add citations to the summary!

I need to keep the JSON minimal while crafting the summary. I want to ensure the summary_md is up to 200 words and covers the main results, highlights the new family and method for upper bounds, and addresses the BST side. I’ll conclude it with the next steps. After that, I’ll include citations for “Corrections and guidance” and “Current Proofs.” Finally, I’ll produce the JSON, making sure that the highlights and next_questions are in string arrays with concise wording!

content.text: {"summary_md":"Last round corrected earlier mistakes (bit-reversal and round-robin families) and introduced a new explicit permutation family π_h (n=4^h): a recursively interleaved 2413-inflation with a midpoint-first constraint and child order 2,4,1,3. UB lower bound: charge only at child-boundary times and use an LCA/bijection between consecutive pairs and node-boundaries; midpoints give rank-distance ≥ s_v/8 to any earlier key, so those boundary steps contribute Θ(log s_v). Summing over levels yields UB(π_h)=Θ(n log n). BST upper bound: choose a static reference tree that splits (I1∪I2) vs (I3∪I4) recursively; each decomposition node produces O(1) alternations so Wilber-1 = O(n). Tango trees then give an explicit algorithm with cost O(n log log n), hence OPT_BST(π_h) ≤ O(n log log n). This achieves OPT = o(UB) (non-strong separation). Next formal tasks: make the LCA/boundary bijection and Wilber-1/filler-node accounting fully rigorous. Citations: \"Corrections and guidance\"; \"Current Proofs\".","one_line_summary":"2413-inflation family gives UB=Θ(n log n) and OPT_BST≤O(n log log n) (non-strong separation).","highlights":["Bit-reversal UB claimed Θ(n log n) was corrected: the argument only yields UB=Ω(n).","Round-robin block construction fails: adjacent-block previous-round witnesses keep many UB_i=O(log k).","New explicit family π_h: recursively interleaved 2413-inflation with midpoint-first constraint (n=4^h).","UB lower bound via child-boundary charging + LCA bijection yields UB(π_h)=Θ(n log n).","Wilber-1 is O(n) for a tailored static reference tree; Tango trees give a BST algorithm with cost O(n log log n), so OPT= o(UB)."],"next_questions":["Formalize the LCA/boundary bijection and write a fully rigorous UB lower-bound proof (no double-counting).","Formalize Wilber-1 analysis including filler-node accounting and attempt to improve OPT to O(n) (Greedy or tailored BST).","Optionally run small-h empirical checks of UB and BST costs to verify constants and behavior."]}

one_line_summary.description: Brief one-line summary for UI display
one_line_summary.title: One Line Summary
